Author: mountaindrifter#4595
Content: Fishy, I certainly see your attention. In fact, I agree with you that it would be great  if everybody shielded their balances. The thing is this is how the parameters of this chain are written. It is exactly how it is suppose to work. Mining to a zaddr is not a goo idea because it adds some protection  to know everytime a coinbase is created. So the current setup is good. If we do not want people to keep coinbase rewards in the  transparent mining address we should create a rule that all coinbase rewards must be moved to a z addr within XX blocks or the balance is sent to me :P. My point is, I agree with you, but the owner of that address is using it in the EXACT way that the parameters of the chain dictate and creating a bounty to discover the owner seems to go against the principles of pirate, IMHO.
